instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the keyboard backlight. When this is low or missing, the keyboard will not light up..
definitions.BKL_SW: What is BKL_SW? BKL_SW means “BACKLIGHT SWITCH” – DC to DC boost circuits increase voltage by putting a lower voltage, like 8 volts, through an inductor. On the other side of the inductor, it is switched to ground rapidly - on this side, you will end up with an increased voltage as a result of the switching. BKL_SW usually refers to the pin on the LED driver that is attached to the inductor. .
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Water damaged mac.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_KBDBKLT</SIGNAL>  5V


BUt i compared with good working and see that  <SIGNAL>BKLT_KEYB1</SIGNAL> and  <SIGNAL>BKLT_KEYB2</SIGNAL> goes to 6-7 Volts when cover sensor near camera on display. But on this one it stais 0. Macos activated up down option for keyboard light control but there is no light. 


Already tried to change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> but same result

Any help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
ALS from webcam is working?
KB control keys get disabled if you put flashlight on the webcam area directly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Yeah, it is disabled when cover sensor, so it seems to work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Try known good keyboard backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Bought it yesterday, in couple of days will try.

but what exactly generate this line <SIGNAL>BKLT_KEYB1</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
KB and LCD backlight have both similar concept, based on boost-converter.
LCD has 6 return lines (<SIGNAL>BKL_ISEN_1</SIGNAL>-6) and KB only two (<SIGNAL>BKLT_KEYB1</SIGNAL>/2).
What voltages do you get at <DIODE>D7720</DIODE>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> get 5V on both points.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: If <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> is not shorted, try another keyboard backlight sheet...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Got new keyboard backlight sheet. Still not working. Checked backlight sheet on other machine and it works. 

What else i can check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> not shorted for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Yes. 5V on both ends. And no short there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>:
Pin 5 12V
Pin 4 - 2,7V
Pin 1-3  - 0V

It is <SIGNAL>BKL_SW</SIGNAL> . Is that normal? Must change <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>?


Also checked XW7720  and there is continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I asked if <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> is shorted; between its pins, of course.
How could I asked you about a short to ground if you already said to have 5V there???

"It is <SIGNAL>BKL_SW</SIGNAL> . Is that normal? Must change <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR>?"
Why do you insist with LCD backlight???
I supposed you only miss KB backlight...

Check <RESISTOR>R7723</RESISTOR>/24/41/47.
Any voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7747</CAPACITOR>?
Also check connections between J4915 and KB backlight circuit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Ok. <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> not shorted between pins.

Yes, Only miss keyboard backlight. LCD is ok.


<RESISTOR>R7741</RESISTOR> is ok (32O Khms)

<RESISTOR>R7724</RESISTOR>/23 are 0.5 instead of 10 Ohms. But i measered on other board and it is also 0.3-0.5 so i think it is ok?

<RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> - 0.2 Ohms


<CAPACITOR>C7747</CAPACITOR> has 0.8V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
0.8V is too low.
Do 2-3 PRAM resets and test again.

<RESISTOR>R7741</RESISTOR> must be 32K aprox, not 320K.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
its 32 Kohm, i put O near 32. 


Done PRAM no result, Also done SMC RESET and NVRAM Reset. Same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Remove <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> and run wire between <CAPACITOR>C7742</CAPACITOR>/47 pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: You mean between Pad 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7742</CAPACITOR> and Pad2 <CAPACITOR>C7747</CAPACITOR> or create continuity between pad 1 and 2 of each component??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Do you really think that I said to short the pads to ground???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: so you told me run wire between  <CAPACITOR>C7742</CAPACITOR>/47 not ground pads?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
May I need to (explicitly) say to force 3V at <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM_KEYB</SIGNAL>???
Don't forget to remove <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Run wire and now there is 3.3 V but still no baclight. 


Also tried with new backlight sheet that 100% is working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> again.
Be sure about all solders, traces and surrounding components...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: I dont have  LP8548B1SQ_-03  but jave  LP8548B1SQ_-04 put it and lcd backlight is gone now, keyboard backlight still not working. DO you know if 03 and 04 are compatible?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
No idea really, didn't swap it.

Are you really sure ALS is OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
What is ALS?

swapped from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (04 version) and backlight on display is back, but still no on keyboard. Its nightmare this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor.
Be sure it works properly.
Check if LCD backlight reacts when you tap the webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: WIll try tomorrow, anyway i tried with other display and was same result. Tomorrow will post about ALS, thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: Checked sensor and display brightness going up and down when flash with light near camera, so it is working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: I found donor with <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> Rev 03 version. Put it. Now when it boot while bing keyboard light flashing once. but after that it doesnt turn on again,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Seems that KB backlight circuit starts and overload is triggered.
Check again signals corresponding to KB backlight section.
Change all caps and L/<DIODE>D7720</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I checked it again and nothing can be found. I removed wire and put back <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> and now again not blinking.


al caps: <CAPACITOR>C7724</CAPACITOR>/25/23/26/27/20 has been changed. L7720 and <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> also changed today (before your message)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: changed L7720 again and now it is working. i dont know exactly if it was just l7220 because i also changed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> again. Anyway i am sure that l7220 had continuity and there was 5V on both pins. Even if it was so may coil fail?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: A coil is more than a simple wire in a buck-converter...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: thank you :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
I remember a friend who I helped online few months ago.
He had a problem with trackpad movement on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.
18.5V is required to work and he changed all in the corresponding area.
ALL, except L5801; guess which was the problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message: coil for sure. Any way to check coil is ok or not? or the only way is changing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard backlight.
threads.message:
Only LCR tester can help.
More easy to test changing the coil...
